content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 §§ 271-6.8 - Backflow

State Regulations

The potable water system shall be installed to preclude
the possibility of backflow. Devices shall be installed to protect against
backflow and backsiphonage at all fixtures and equipment where an air gap at
least twice the diameter of the water system inlet is not provided between the
water supply inlet and the fixtures flood level rim. No hose shall be attached
to a faucet that is not equipped with a backflow prevention
device. Notes
